alert.note: Alert for Alaska Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 22 at 4:19AM AKST until December 23 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON AKST SATURDAY FOR THE BERING SEA COAST OF THE ALASKA PENINSULA... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 6 inches. Northeast to northwest winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...Bering Sea coast of the Alaska Peninsula, including the communities of False Pass, Cold Bay, and Nelson Lagoon. * WHEN...From 6 AM Friday to noon AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Visibility is expected to continue decreasing as temperatures cool and winds shift more northerly Friday afternoon. The south/Pacific side of the Alaska Peninsula (including King Cove, Sand Point, and Perryville) will be particularly gusty, but visibility is not expected to drop below one half mile due to warmer temperatures.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
